revised_title: Investigating the Law of Variation of Magnetic Forces Generated at Different Distances during Rotation
tldr: The author, S. H. Christie, investigates the mutual action of magnetic particles and the law of variation of magnetic forces during rotation. He discovers that the greatest development of magnetism in a disc occurs when the axes of the magnets are vertically under points bisecting the radii, and that magnetism decreases rapidly as they approach the edge. The author also establishes a law of variation of magnetic force, which varies inversely as the 4th power of the distance between the poles of the magnets and the corresponding poles in the ring.
